result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Daniel Salas Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Jose Daniel Salas Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Elm. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Daniel Salas Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Jose Daniel Salas Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Witness was out on an active arrest and unable to appear. Defense objects to an adjournment.  Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
There needs to be a hearing on this issue.
